New Records: Cade Smith set a Division Series relief record with 12 strikeouts by a reliever.
Parker Meadows tied Charlie Gehringer for the longest hitting streak to start a postseason career in Tigers history with hits in all seven postseason games.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam off Tigers ace Tarik Skubal in the fifth inning.
Jose Ramirez was hit by a 99.9 mph fastball to force in the game-tying run.
Hunter Gaddis struck out Kerry Carpenter to escape a bases-loaded jam in the sixth inning.
Colt Keith doubled home Riley Greene in the seventh inning to cut the lead to two runs.
Eli Morgan struck out Wenceel Perez and Spencer Torkelson to strand Colt Keith at second base in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch expressed pride in his team's effort and determination.
Hinch mentioned that the loss would serve as motivation for the next season.
Jake Rogers praised Tarik Skubal's performance despite the loss.
Kerry Carpenter expressed his determination to contribute to the team despite his injury.
Hinch highlighted the bullpen's performance, particularly Cade Smith, Hunter Gaddis, and Emmanuel Clase.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers made their first playoff berth in 10 years.
The Guardians will advance to play the New York Yankees in the American League Championship Series.
The Tigers missed a chance to make their eighth appearance in the ALCS since the divisional format was created in 1969.
